Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Managed to make my first CC with custom CC... very very simple one. Burns coins and submits chain params to the CC cntract allowing to retreive them later. 
Basically just send the chain params as the only argument for the RPC, and it extracts the supply checks if over minimum amount and tehn creates a tx to teh unspendable CC address. Validation is simple return false, as the coins are never allowed to be spent. 
May need to be combined with oracles, to be useful for LABS chain creation üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Well it does the burn tx fine. Need some more RPCs to finish it off and get the data back out, but thats the easy part.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
I worked out at least at a high level how to make LUA scripts for a CC code... not sure how useful it would be ... it could speed up testing code though as you can update the script then just run the RPC again without having to recompile and restarrt. 
I think though to make anything actually useful could turn into a massive task.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Using external scripts for consensus code is ovbiously a bad idea... But that said to just mess with the CC's by writing LUA scripts  could help people understand how they work better. I think there would be maybe 20-30 functions inside the code that need a wrapper to be able to be used inside the scripts. Not sure if this is anything anyone wants. Just an idea I had.

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content:
I have 2 questions 
1) When running the command 
`./komodod -ac_name=TXSCLCC -ac_supply=0 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=54.36.126.42 -addnode=94.130.224.11 &`
Do I need to inlcude my pubkey as well ? 
2) I was following the Smart Contract Test Plan in the min message , when running the command 
`./komodo-cli -ac_name=TXSCLCC dicelist` 
it returns a null array, which means there are currently no dice contract deployed on the TXSCLCC ac ?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can either use `-pubkey=0xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx` on the chain start command or use `./komodo-cli -ac_name=TXSCLCC setpubkey 0xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx` after the chain has started.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: almost similar way like this https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/Get-Started-with-Rogue-Game#step-1---start-the-chain

Author: PHBA2061#2530
SHossain#0007
Content: did you create a new dice plan on TXSCLCC?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: are you fully synced?

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: I see, my komodo data is not fully synced yet, till now I was working only with my own test chain, so there's no need to sync, thank you üòÉ

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Looking at the docs for Dilithium it says "The Dilithium CC allows for quantum resistant transactions on any Komodo assetchain that supports it." does this mean Dilithium signatures or the "Q" addresses aren't available for KMD?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Not available on KMD. Might be available on KMDCC later this year. Whether or not it'll be on KMDCC is a question for jl

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: is KMDCC fungible with KMD?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Regnar yes

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: fungible as in KMD can move to KMDCC at a 1 for 1 rate, burned on one, created on another.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Not burned, held in a gateway I believe. Don't know the full details though, I could be wrong

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: that works too. I'm not sure on the best way to do it, just wondering if people buying and holding KMD will have the benefits of many of the CC tech that will be on KMDCC, or if they will have to mine/buy a different coin all together.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: They're different chains obviously, these questions I think a pretty unique to Komodo's situation so I figured they are worth asking

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: interchangeable

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Right that's what I figured, KMD as a chain isn't implementing these CCs, other chains can build with them, including KMDCC

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Where can I find information on the difference between KMD and KMDCC, is there an explorer for KMDCC? chain params to run it in Komodod? is it being mined separately from KMD?

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Or am I misunderstanding KMDCC?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: KMDCC doesn't exist yet, eta is Q2

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Difference is z-addresses support and some CCs activated

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `is it being mined separately from KMD?` - I wonder yes, since its assetchain

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: That sounds like it won't be fungible with KMD?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: 1:1 KMD <-> KMDCC gateway planned

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So it'll be fungible with KMD

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: that's good to hear. I was hoping I wouldn't have to choose between cool KMDCC and KMD as an investment.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I would assume Dilithium would make it to KMD though eventually

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: seeing as that seems much more security related than other CCs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMDCC to use the CC denominated in KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1:1 automated multisig gateway will exist to allow fungibility between the two

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Good to know, thanks.
